H0.text: Biome is the lowest level of environmental organization that includes the water quality and air temperature in an area.

H1.text: An ecosystem is the lowest level of environmental organization that would include the water quality and air temperature in an area.

H2.text: Community is the lowest level of environmental organization that would include the water quality and air temperature in an area.

H3.text: Population is the lowest level of environmental organization that would include the water quality and air temperature in an area.

A4.text: Biomes are always defined at a very general level.

A5.text: Climate determines the biome in which the ecosystem is embedded.

A6.text: Biomes are larger units of organization that categorize regions of the Earth's ecosystems, mainly according to the structure and composition of vegetation.

A7.text: organisms, to populations, to guilds, to communities, to ecosystems, to biomes, and up to the level of the biosphere.

A8.text: Such populations as a whole constitute a community.

A9.text: A population is a group of organisms of the same species which inhabit the same geographical area and are capable of interbreeding.
